00035 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00036 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)
00037 
00038 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   4096
00039 
00040 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00041 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00042 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00044 #define xnarch_alloc_stack xnmalloc
00045 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree

00047 struct xnthread;
00048 struct task_struct;
00049 
00050 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00051 
00052     /* Kernel mode side */
00053 
00054 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00055     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00056        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00057     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00058     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00059     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00060     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00061        - NULL for RT K threads,
00062        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00063        - current for RT US threads.
00064     */
00065 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00066 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00067 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00068 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00069 
00070     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00071     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00072     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00073     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00074 
00075     /* User mode side */
00076     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00077     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00078 
00079     /* Init block */
00080     struct xnthread *self;
00081     int imask;
00082     const char *name;
00083     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00084     void *cookie;
00085 
00086 } xnarchtcb_t;
00087 
00088 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00089 
00090     unsigned exception;
00091     struct pt_regs *regs;
00092 
00093 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00094 
00095 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00096 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->regs->dar)
00097 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00098 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00099 /* FIXME: FPU faults ignored by the nanokernel on PPC. */
00100 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  (0)
00101 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00102    Linux stack context. */
00103 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_ACCESS_TRAP)
00104 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00105                                  ((fi)->exception != ADEOS_IABR_TRAP && \
00106                                   (fi)->exception != ADEOS_SSTEP_TRAP && \
00107                                   (fi)->exception != ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP))
00108 #ifdef __cplusplus
00109 extern "C" {
00110 #endif

00112 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00113 
00114 {
00115 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00116     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00117         return vmalloc(bytes);
00118 #endif
00119 
00120     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00121 }
00122 
00123 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00124 
00125 {
00126 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00127     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00128         vfree(chunk);
00129     else
00130 #endif
00131         kfree(chunk);
00132 }

00134 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00135 
00136 {
00137     rthal_irq_host_pend(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);

00146 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00147                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))

00149     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00152 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00153 
00154 {
00155     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00156 
00157     rthal_load_cpuid();
00158 
00159     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00160        and always inside a critical section. */
00161     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00162     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00163     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00164 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00165     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00166     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00167     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00168                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00169                     : NULL);
00170 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00171 }
00172 
00173 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00174     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00175 }
00176 
00177 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00178                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00179 {
00180     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00181     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00182 
00183     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00184 
00185     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00186         {
00187         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00188 
00189         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00190 
00191 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00192         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00193            they don't work properly in our context. */
00194         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00195             asm volatile (
00196                 "dssall;\n"
00197 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00198                 "sync;\n"
00199 #endif
00200                 : : );
00201         }
00202 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00203 
00204         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00205         get_mmu_context(mm);
00206         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00207 
00208         /* _switch expects a valid "current" (r2) for storing
00209          * ALTIVEC and SPE state. */
00210         current = prev;
00211         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00212 
00213         barrier();
00214         }
00215     else
00216         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00217         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00218 }
00219 
00220 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00221                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00222 {
00223     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00224 }
00225 
00226 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00227 
00228 {
00229     /* Empty */
00230 }

00232 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00233                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00234                                          const char *name)
00235 {
00236     tcb->user_task = current;
00237     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00238     tcb->ksp = 0;
00239     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00240 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00241     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00242     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00243 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00244     tcb->entry = NULL;
00245     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00246     tcb->self = thread;
00247     tcb->imask = 0;
00248     tcb->name = name;
00249 }
00250 
00251 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00252 
00253 {
00254     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00255     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00256     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00257     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00258 }
00259 
00260 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00261                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00262                                        void *cookie,
00263                                        int imask,
00264                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00265                                        char *name)
00266 {
00267     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00268 
00269     rthal_local_irq_flags_hw(flags);
00270 
00271     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00272     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00273     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00274     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00275     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00276     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00277 
00278     tcb->entry = entry;
00279     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00280     tcb->self = thread;
00281     tcb->imask = imask;
00282     tcb->name = name;
00283 }
00284 
00285 /* No lazy FPU init on PPC. */
00286 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) (1)
00287 
00288 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00289 
00290 {
00291 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00292     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00293         rthal_enable_fpu();
00294 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00295 }
00296 
00297 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00298 
00299 {
00300 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00301     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00302        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00303     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00304     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00305 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00306 }
00307 
00308 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00309 
00310 {
00311 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00312 
00313     if(tcb->fpup)
00314         {
00315         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00316 
00317         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00318             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00319         }   
00320 
00321 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00322 }
00323 
00324 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00325 
00326 {
00327 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00328 
00329     if(tcb->fpup)
00330         {
00331         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00332 
00333         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00334             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00335         }   
00336 
00337     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00338        could be much lazier. */
00339     if(tcb->user_task)
00340         rthal_disable_fpu();
00341 
00342 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00343 }
00344 
00345 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00346 
00347 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00348 
00349 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00350 
00351     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00352     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00353     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00354 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00355     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00356     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00357 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00358     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00359 }
00360 
00361 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00362 
00363 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00364 
00365 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00366                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00367                                            const char *name)
00368 {
00369     struct task_struct *task = current;
00370 
00371     tcb->user_task = task;
00372     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00373     tcb->ksp = 0;
00374     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00375 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00376     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00377     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00378 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00379     tcb->entry = NULL;
00380     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00381     tcb->self = thread;
00382     tcb->imask = 0;
00383     tcb->name = name;
00384 }
00385 
00386 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00387 
00388 {
00389     unsigned irq;
00390 
00391     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00392         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00393                              irq,
00394                              handler,
00395                              NULL,
00396                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00397 
00398     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00399        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00400        individually. */
00401 
00402     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00403                          ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00404                          handler,
00405                          NULL,
00406                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00407 }
00408 
00409 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00410 
00411 {
00412     unsigned irq;
00413 
00414     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00415         {
00416         switch (irq)
00417             {
00418 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00419             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00420 
00421                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00422                 continue;
00423 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00424 
00425             default:
00426 
00427                 rthal_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00428             }
00429         }
00430 
00431     rthal_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00432 }
00433 
00434 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00435 
00436 {
00437     unsigned irq;
00438 
00439     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00440         {
00441         switch (irq)
00442             {
00443 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00444             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00445 
00446                 continue;
00447 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00448 
00449             default:
00450 
00451                 rthal_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00452             }
00453         }
00454 
00455     rthal_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00456 }
00457 
00458 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00460 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00461 
00462 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00463     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00464        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00465        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00466        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00467        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00468        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00469     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00470 }
00471 
00472 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00473     rthal_timer_release();
00474 }

00476 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00477 
00478 {
00479 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00480     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00481 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00482     return 0;
00483 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00484 }

00488 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE

00490 #include <linux/init.h>
00491 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00492 
00493 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00494 
00495 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00496 
00497 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00498 
00499 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00500 
00501 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00502 
00503 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00504 
00505 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00506 {
00507     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00508     fltinfo.exception = event;
00509     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00510     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00511 }
00512 
00513 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00514 
00515 {
00516 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00517     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00518 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00519     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00520        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00521     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00522 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00523 }
00524 
00525 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00526 
00527 {
00528     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00529 
00530     if (!nktimerlat)
00531         return -ENODEV;
00532 
00533     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00534 
00535     return 0;
00536 }
00537 
00538 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00539 
00540 {
00541     int err;
00542 
00543 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00544     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00545        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00546     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00547 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00548 
00549     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00550 
00551     if (err)
00552         return err;
00553 
00554     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00555 
00556     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00557         return -ENOSYS;
00558 
00559     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00560                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00561                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00562                          NULL,
00563                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00564 
00565     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00566 
00567 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00568     err = xnshadow_mount();
00569 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00570 
00571     if (err)
00572         {
00573         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00574         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00575         }
00576 
00577     return err;
00578 }
00579 
00580 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00581 
00582 {
00583 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00584     xnshadow_cleanup();
00585 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00586     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00587     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00588 }
00589 
00590 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00591 
00592 #ifdef __cplusplus
00593 }
00594 #endif

00596 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */

00598 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00599 #include <bits/local_lim.h>

00601 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
